Key Match Events: The Minnesota Timberwolves' size advantage and better execution on both ends of the floor pushed them to a 124-107 win.
The LA Lakers and the Minnesota Timberwolves played minimal defense in the third quarter.
Minnesota's second-stringers, composed mainly of veterans, kept the Lakers in check.
Chris Finch kept his starters in for almost the entire first quarter, giving Donte DiVincenzo an extended run with his old reliables.
The former New York Knicks guard responded with 11 points on 4-for-4 shooting, including 3-for-3 from deep.
Pre-Game Insights: The Minnesota Timberwolves and the LA Lakers open their preseason with a matchup at the Acrisure Arena on Friday.
Superstars like LeBron James, Anthony Davis, Anthony Edwards and Julius Randle were unavailable, but a packed venue greeted the teams.
Post-Match Reflections: The Timberwolves eventually walked away with a 124-107 victory.
Chris Finch's veterans, particularly in the first three quarters, carried the team.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The much-awaited debut of Bronny James happened in the second quarter.
Dalton Knecht showed why he was a first-round pick in this year's draft.
The fourth quarter was when JJ Redick and Chris Finch emptied their respective benches.
Others: Timberwolves Nation! You can check out the latest Minnesota Timberwolves Schedule and dive into the Timberwolves Depth Chart for NBA Season 2024-25.
